title.narrative: Countries enabled to strengthen their health systems to address population-specific health needs and barriers to equity across the life course

description.narrative: Improved access to quality essential health services irrespective of gender, age or disability

Preventable maternal, newborn and child mortality (Global strategy on Women?s, Children?s, Adolescents? Health 2016-2030); access to family planning; routine immunization (Global Immunization Vision and Strategy 2021?2030) incl. transitioned polio vaccination; transition out of support from Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, and increase allocation to vaccine procurement compared with the 2019 allocation; integrated childhood development; human papillomavirus tests for cervical screening (global strategy to accelerate the elimination of cervical cancer); causes of adolescent death (Global Accelerated Action for the Health of Adolescents); prevent morbidity and mortality and promote health, growth and development; complex health needs of older people (Decade of Healthy Ageing 2020?2030); barriers to accessing essential health services throughout the life course for people with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), United States of America
Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE), France
United Nations Fund for International Partnerships (UNFIP)

provider-org.narrative: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), United States of America

title.narrative: Triple billion targets - tracking the work of WHO, countries, regions and partners to meet the Triple Billion targets and health-related Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Country Cooperation Strategy Brief - Burkina Faso (2018)
